meanings.definition: A large newspaper, typically measuring 23 inches by 29 inches.
meanings.sent1: The broadsheets were filled with news about the local community.
meanings.sent2: I prefer reading broadsheets because they contain in-depth articles.
meanings.sent3: When the cat knocked over the stack of broadsheets, it looked like a paper avalanche.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a broadsheet of information, neatly organized and easily accessible.
meanings.sent5: The broadsheets rustled like autumn leaves as she turned the pages.

meanings.definition: A newspaper printed on large sheets of paper, usually considered more serious and intellectual than tabloids.
meanings.sent1: The broadsheets provided detailed analysis of the political situation.
meanings.sent2: In the library, you can find a variety of broadsheets from different publishers.
meanings.sent3: The broadsheets were so serious that even the crossword puzzles seemed scholarly.
meanings.sent4: His words were like broadsheets, heavy with meaning and depth.
meanings.sent5: The broadsheets stood out among the magazines, exuding an air of sophistication.
